data.title: Blackface Reflections African Americans Movies by George Nelson, First Edition
data.meta_description: Blackface: Reflections on African-Americans and the Movies(a first printing) by George, Nelson and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.co.uk.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. US1ST.EDIITON.1ST.IMPRESSION.A VG+ HARDBACK IN A VG+ DUSTWRAPPER.14.Language: eng Language: eng 0.0 Language: eng 0.0 Language: eng 0.0 Language: eng 0.0 Language: eng Language: eng.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. 8vo. 213pp. First printing, full numberline line. Signed by George on the title page. Brown papered boards with black quarter cloth and silver spine titles. NF/NF. Bottom rear board corner very lightly bumped, light pushing at spine ends, else near fine. In an unclipped, near fine jacket with light crumpling at the spine ends. Essays on film and race by a noted New York music and culture critic. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. First edition. Octavo; First edition; G+/VG-; Hardcover with DJ; DJ spine, white with gold print; DJ in mylar, slight wear at bottom of spine, but clean and bright; Boards quarter bound with black cloth to spine and orange paper to boards, silver print, slight wear to spine caps, cocked spine, else clean and strong; Text block has slight spotting to top edge but is clean and tight; Signed in ink by the author on the title page; xv, 224 pages, illustrated (b&w). 1327443. FP New Rockville Stock.

SIGNED hardcover first edition - First printing. Covers the period from 1963-94. Each section of essays is preceded by a brief chronological listing of highlights (good and bad) during the period. SIGNED on the title page. Illustrated with photographs. Index. 224 pp. Very good in very good dust jacket (black line on bottom edge, corners slightly bumped, crease on dj flap.).

First edition SIGNED: Fine and bright in very close to fine dustjacket with crisp text throughout. Signed by Nelson George on the full title page.
